conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, multiple faces visible, interior volume readable, and an elevated angled view with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and cutaway. Minor simplifications in corner/partition detailing and some openings are not cleanly expressed as true 3D door frames.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room locations match (bedroom top-left, toilet/utility top-right zone, kitchen right, living/dining center-left, balcony bottom-left). However, the foyer/entry partitioning and some internal wall lengths/door placements appear simplified or shifted vs the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture/fixtures present: bed, dining table, sofa, kitchen counter/cooktop, toilet/sink, utility appliance blocks. Some items are generic blocks and not all fixtures match the exact plan layout.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry and materials; good separation of walls/floors. Limited detail on doors/windows and fairly plain lighting/materials reduce clarity of openings and room boundaries.

detected_errors.description: Foyer/entry region is not as clearly partitioned as in the 2D plan; some internal wall segments and circulation boundaries appear simplified or slightly relocated.
Door/window placement and representation do not fully match the 2D plan (several openings are simplified and exact swing/position is unclear).
Furniture/fixtures are approximate blocks; some appliance/fixture placement detail (kitchen/utility/bath) is not fully faithful to the plan.
Rendering is clean but minimal; limited material/lighting differentiation makes some boundaries/openings less distinct.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway with strong overall layout correspondence, but with noticeable simplification/mismatch in foyer partitioning and some door/window placements.
